description.content: Bioluminescence is a chemical reaction produced by living organisms for various purposes. Offer your children a new way to discover and learn about bioluminescent species by letting them explore an interactive exhibition on their own.

discover.title: What You'll Discover
discover.content: Bioluminescence is a chemical reaction produced by living organisms for various purposes. Bioluminescence is a chemical reaction produced by living organisms.

Connais-tu les poissons lanternes ? Ce s: Have you heard of lanternfish? They are bioluminescent fish, which means they produce their own light through a series of chemical reactions.
À quoi sert cette bioluminescence ? Sous: What is the purpose of this bioluminescence? Under the ocean, every living organism uses it for a specific reason: to reproduce, hunt, camouflage, or protect themselves, for example.
Tous ces êtres vivants cohabitent ensemb: All these living organisms coexist in the ocean, they hunt, reproduce, and swim together. This is what we call an ecosystem.
findYourFish: Find the fish you personalized during the exhibition !
